### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
Desmopressin is the drug of choice for neurogenic diabetes insipidus due to its ability to effectively mimic natural antidiuretic hormone (ADH), addressing the deficiency seen in this condition. It binds to renal receptors to reduce urine output and increase urine osmolality, thus restoring normal fluid balance. This choice is supported by medical consensus on its mechanism and effectiveness.
